com.whirvis.jraknet.protocol

Class ConnectionType

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.protocol.ConnectionType

  • public final class ConnectionType
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to signify which implementation of the RakNet protocol is being used by a connection. This functionality has no guarantee of functioning completely, as it is dependent on the implementation to implement this feature themselves.

    As of March 1st, 2019, the only known implementations using this connection type protocol are:

    • JRakNet by Whirvis T. Wheatley
    • RakLib by PocketMine-MP
    Since:
    JRakNet v2.9.0
    Author:
    Whirvis T. Wheatley
    See Also:
    Identifier

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionType

        private ConnectionType(java.util.UUID uuid,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String language,
                       java.lang.String version,
                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata,
                       boolean vanilla)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a connection type implementation descriptor.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the universally unique ID of the implementation
        name - the name of the implementation.
        language - the name of the programming language the implementation was programmed in.
        version - the version of the implementation.
        metadata - the metadata of the implementation. Metadata for an implementation can be created using the createMetaData(String...) method.
        vanilla - true if the implementation is a vanilla implementation, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are more than 255 metadata values.

        language - the name of the programming language the implementation was programmed in.
        version - the version of the implementation.
        metadata - the metadata of the implementation. Metadata for an implementation can be created using the createMetaData(String...) method.

        Returns whether or not the connection type is a VANILLA implementation.
        Returns:

      • is

        public boolean is(ConnectionType connectionType)
        Returns whether or not this implementation and the specified implementation are the same implementation based on the UUID.

        If the UUID of both implementations are null then false will be returned since we have no logical way of telling if the two implementations are actually the same as there are no UUIDs to compare.

        Parameters:
        connectionType - the connection type.
        Returns:
        true if both implementations are the same, false otherwise.
